cell.html: Located at the mouth of the Yangtze River , Shanghai is mainland China's economic powerhouse and largest city. Shanghai was opened up to trade as a result of the 1842 Treaty of Nanjing that ended the First Opium War . Foreign investment collapsed after the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949; however, in 1992 foreign direct investment was encouraged, and Shanghai's economy has since been growing at an amazing pace.
cell.text: Located at the mouth of the Yangtze River , Shanghai is mainland China's economic powerhouse and largest city. Shanghai was opened up to trade as a result of the 1842 Treaty of Nanjing that ended the First Opium War . Foreign investment collapsed after the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949; however, in 1992 foreign direct investment was encouraged, and Shanghai's economy has since been growing at an amazing pace.

cell.html: China's capital and center for sciences and the arts. Beijing is one of the hubs where major national transportation routes converge. It is rich in historical and cultural heritage.
cell.text: China's capital and center for sciences and the arts. Beijing is one of the hubs where major national transportation routes converge. It is rich in historical and cultural heritage.

cell.html: Better known to many English speakers as Canton, Guangzhou is a city in Guangdong province . It is a port on the Pearl River , navigable to the South China Sea , and is located about 120 km (75 miles) northwest of Hong Kong.
cell.text: Better known to many English speakers as Canton, Guangzhou is a city in Guangdong province . It is a port on the Pearl River , navigable to the South China Sea , and is located about 120 km (75 miles) northwest of Hong Kong.

cell.html: Shenzhen once a small fishing village, singled out by Deng Xiaoping and became the first of the Special Economic Zones (SEZ) in China since the late 1970s has been one of the fastest growing cities in the world due to its proximity to Hong Kong , once a British colony until 1997 . It is also the busiest port in China after Shanghai .
cell.text: Shenzhen once a small fishing village, singled out by Deng Xiaoping and became the first of the Special Economic Zones (SEZ) in China since the late 1970s has been one of the fastest growing cities in the world due to its proximity to Hong Kong , once a British colony until 1997 . It is also the busiest port in China after Shanghai .

cell.html: Hong Kong Island was first occupied by British forces in 1841, and then formally ceded from China under the Treaty of Nanjing at the end of the war. Hong Kong remained a crown colony of the United Kingdom until 1997 when it was returned to China.
cell.text: Hong Kong Island was first occupied by British forces in 1841, and then formally ceded from China under the Treaty of Nanjing at the end of the war. Hong Kong remained a crown colony of the United Kingdom until 1997 when it was returned to China.

cell.html: On December 7, 1949, Chiang Kai-shek established Taipei as the provisional capital of the ROC after the Communists forced them to flee mainland China. Both factions initially laid claim to the Chinese mainland as result of a civil war. However, The nationalist government of the ROC (Taiwan) has long since abandoned their claim on the mainland. However, the Communist party of mainland China still claims Taiwan as a Chinese territory.
cell.text: On December 7, 1949, Chiang Kai-shek established Taipei as the provisional capital of the ROC after the Communists forced them to flee mainland China. Both factions initially laid claim to the Chinese mainland as result of a civil war. However, The nationalist government of the ROC (Taiwan) has long since abandoned their claim on the mainland. However, the Communist party of mainland China still claims Taiwan as a Chinese territory.

cell.html: Tianjin's urban area is located along the Hai He River. Its ports, some distance away, are located on Bohai Gulf . The manufacturing sector is the largest and fastest-growing sector of Tianjin's economy.
cell.text: Tianjin's urban area is located along the Hai He River. Its ports, some distance away, are located on Bohai Gulf . The manufacturing sector is the largest and fastest-growing sector of Tianjin's economy.

cell.html: Wuhan is a city in Hubei province that lies at the east of the Jianghan Plain and the intersection of the middle reaches of the Yangtze and Han rivers. It is a major transportation hub, with dozens of railways, roads and expressways passing through the city. In the 1920s, Wuhan was the capital of a leftist Kuomintang (KMT) government led by Wang Jingwei in opposition to Chiang Kai-shek . Wuhan is now recognized as the political, economic, financial, cultural, educational and transportation center of central China.
cell.text: Wuhan is a city in Hubei province that lies at the east of the Jianghan Plain and the intersection of the middle reaches of the Yangtze and Han rivers. It is a major transportation hub, with dozens of railways, roads and expressways passing through the city. In the 1920s, Wuhan was the capital of a leftist Kuomintang (KMT) government led by Wang Jingwei in opposition to Chiang Kai-shek . Wuhan is now recognized as the political, economic, financial, cultural, educational and transportation center of central China.

cell.html: ../../../../images/shared/thumb/e/e5/Img.沈阳故宫冬景.jpg/150px-Img.沈阳故宫冬景.jpg

cell.html: A city in Liaoning province , Shenyang is an important industrial center in China, and the transportation and commercial centre of China's Northeastern region. At its peak in the 1970s, Shenyang was one of the top three industrial centers in China. The economy of the city has revived significantly in recent years, thanks to Chinese government's Revitalize Northeast China campaign and the rapid development of software and auto manufacturing industries. Many major industrial companies have their headquarters in Shenyang.
cell.text: A city in Liaoning province , Shenyang is an important industrial center in China, and the transportation and commercial centre of China's Northeastern region. At its peak in the 1970s, Shenyang was one of the top three industrial centers in China. The economy of the city has revived significantly in recent years, thanks to Chinese government's Revitalize Northeast China campaign and the rapid development of software and auto manufacturing industries. Many major industrial companies have their headquarters in Shenyang.

cell.html: Changchun has a complete industrial system with 128 categories and over 3,000 types of products. As Changchun's main industry, the manufacturing of transportation facilities and machinery such as those of automobiles, passenger trains, and tractors have developed very well. It's total output of those products constitutes, respectively, 1/5, 1/2, and 1/10 of that of the nation's.
cell.text: Changchun has a complete industrial system with 128 categories and over 3,000 types of products. As Changchun's main industry, the manufacturing of transportation facilities and machinery such as those of automobiles, passenger trains, and tractors have developed very well. It's total output of those products constitutes, respectively, 1/5, 1/2, and 1/10 of that of the nation's.

cell.html: This city in Heilongjiang province lies on the southern bank of the Songhua River . It serves as a key political, economic, scientific, cultural and communications center of Northeastern China. Harbin is originally a Manchu word meaning 'a place for drying fishing nets.'
cell.text: This city in Heilongjiang province lies on the southern bank of the Songhua River . It serves as a key political, economic, scientific, cultural and communications center of Northeastern China. Harbin is originally a Manchu word meaning 'a place for drying fishing nets.'

cell.html: This city in Sichuan province has risen as an IT and electronic R&D powerhouse. Chengdu's Hi-tech Industrial Development Zone has attracted a variety of multinationals, including Intel , IBM , NOKIA , Alcatel , Motorola , SAP , Microsoft , and Lenovo . Chengdu is a financial hub for Western China and has successfully attracted major international financial institutions. Chengdu is also known for manufacturing Chinese military aviation technology such as the J-10 Fighter .
cell.text: This city in Sichuan province has risen as an IT and electronic R&amp;D powerhouse. Chengdu's Hi-tech Industrial Development Zone has attracted a variety of multinationals, including Intel , IBM , NOKIA , Alcatel , Motorola , SAP , Microsoft , and Lenovo . Chengdu is a financial hub for Western China and has successfully attracted major international financial institutions. Chengdu is also known for manufacturing Chinese military aviation technology such as the J-10 Fighter .

cell.html: Jinan is the capital city of Shandong province .
cell.text: Jinan is the capital city of Shandong province .

cell.html: Chongqing is a major inland trading port transporting goods from the southwestern provinces to eastern China. Known for heavy industrial and military industry, Chongqing is home to Asia's largest aluminum plant, South West Aluminium. The surrounding area is rich in natural resources, with more than forty kinds of minerals with coal reserves estimated to be 4.8 billion tonnes. It has China's largest natural gas field. Chongqing's agricultural sector still employs a significant portion of the population. The city has been used as a resettlement area for refugees from the Three Gorges Dam project.
cell.text: Chongqing is a major inland trading port transporting goods from the southwestern provinces to eastern China. Known for heavy industrial and military industry, Chongqing is home to Asia's largest aluminum plant, South West Aluminium. The surrounding area is rich in natural resources, with more than forty kinds of minerals with coal reserves estimated to be 4.8 billion tonnes. It has China's largest natural gas field. Chongqing's agricultural sector still employs a significant portion of the population. The city has been used as a resettlement area for refugees from the Three Gorges Dam project.

cell.html: This city in Zhejiang province is one of the most renowned and prosperous cities of China for much of the last 1,000 years. Hangzhou is also well-known for its beautiful natural scenery, with the West Lake (Xī Hú, 西湖) as the most noteworthy location. Hangzhou's industries have traditionally been textile, silk and machinery, but electronics and other light industries are developing, especially since the start of the new open economy in 1992. Tea from Hangzhou, particular Longjing (龙井) or Dragon Well Tea is a famed export. In 2004, 2005 and 2006 Forbes magazine ranked Hangzhou the number 1 city in China for business.
cell.text: This city in Zhejiang province is one of the most renowned and prosperous cities of China for much of the last 1,000 years. Hangzhou is also well-known for its beautiful natural scenery, with the West Lake (Xī Hú, 西湖) as the most noteworthy location. Hangzhou's industries have traditionally been textile, silk and machinery, but electronics and other light industries are developing, especially since the start of the new open economy in 1992. Tea from Hangzhou, particular Longjing (龙井) or Dragon Well Tea is a famed export. In 2004, 2005 and 2006 Forbes magazine ranked Hangzhou the number 1 city in China for business.

cell.html: This industrial city in Hebei province has transportation, coal mining, iron, steel and textile mills, chemical, and cement plants.
cell.text: This industrial city in Hebei province has transportation, coal mining, iron, steel and textile mills, chemical, and cement plants.
A Prefecture-level city in Shanxi Province .

cell.html: The capital city of Jiangsu province ; Nanjing has previously served as the capital of China during several historical periods. Located in the downstream Yangtze River drainage basin. Nanjing has been a national hub of education, research, transportation and tourism throughout history.
cell.text: The capital city of Jiangsu province ; Nanjing has previously served as the capital of China during several historical periods. Located in the downstream Yangtze River drainage basin. Nanjing has been a national hub of education, research, transportation and tourism throughout history.

cell.html: Xi'an is the capital city of Shaanxi province. With 3,100 years of recorded history Xi'an is one of the most important cities in Chinese history. It was the capital of China for 13 dynasties, including the Zhou , Qin , Han , and the Tang dynasties. It was renowned for being the eastern terminus of the Silk Road and for the location of the Terracotta Army made during the Qin Dynasty . Since the 1990s, Xi'an has re-emerged as an important cultural, industrial and educational center of the central-northwest region, with facilities for research and development, national security and China's space exploration program.
cell.text: Xi'an is the capital city of Shaanxi province. With 3,100 years of recorded history Xi'an is one of the most important cities in Chinese history. It was the capital of China for 13 dynasties, including the Zhou , Qin , Han , and the Tang dynasties. It was renowned for being the eastern terminus of the Silk Road and for the location of the Terracotta Army made during the Qin Dynasty . Since the 1990s, Xi'an has re-emerged as an important cultural, industrial and educational center of the central-northwest region, with facilities for research and development, national security and China's space exploration program.
A Prefecture-level city in Gansu Province .

cell.html: This city in Liaoning province is China's northernmost ice-free seaport and is China's most livable city. It is also one of the most heavily developed industrial areas of China. Located west of the Yellow Sea and east of Bohai Sea roughly in the middle of the Liaodong/Liaotung peninsula at its narrowest neck or isthmus.
cell.text: This city in Liaoning province is China's northernmost ice-free seaport and is China's most livable city. It is also one of the most heavily developed industrial areas of China. Located west of the Yellow Sea and east of Bohai Sea roughly in the middle of the Liaodong/Liaotung peninsula at its narrowest neck or isthmus.
A Prefecture-level city in Henan Province .

cell.html: One of Taiwan's Central Municipalities also the second largest city in Taiwan . However, the Communist party of mainland China still claims Taiwan as a Chinese territory.
cell.text: One of Taiwan's Central Municipalities also the second largest city in Taiwan . However, the Communist party of mainland China still claims Taiwan as a Chinese territory.

cell.html: The Third Biggest city in Taiwan behind Taipei and Kaohsiung in central region of the west cost of Taiwan Island.
cell.text: The Third Biggest city in Taiwan behind Taipei and Kaohsiung in central region of the west cost of Taiwan Island.

cell.html: Qingdao today is a major seaport, naval base, and industrial center in Shandong province . It is also the site of the Tsing-tao Brewery. The character 青 (qīng) in Chinese means "green" or "lush," while the character 岛 (dǎo) means "island." It was recently named China's 9th-most livable city by China Daily .

context.text: List of cities in China - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Chinese Hanyu Pinyin City Population Image Description
^ There are some restrictions on the movement of labor between Hong Kong and mainland China.

This article is about any city in China . For cities of the People's Republic of China by province, see List of cities in the People's Republic of China . For cities in Taiwan (Republic of China) listed alphabetically, see List of cities in Taiwan .
This disambiguation page lists articles associated with the same title. If an internal link led you here, you may wish to change the link to point directly to the intended article.
